36namespace {

38using ImportExportKey = std::pair<ImportExportKindCode, uint32_t>;
39
40enum ReturnLocation { kAfterBreakpoint, kAfterWasmCall };
41
42Address FindNewPC(WasmFrame* frame, WasmCode* wasm_code, int byte_offset,
43 ReturnLocation return_location) {
44 base::Vector<const uint8_t> new_pos_table = wasm_code->source_positions();
45
46 DCHECK_LE(0, byte_offset);
47
48 // Find the size of the call instruction by computing the distance from the
49 // source position entry to the return address.
50 WasmCode* old_code = frame->wasm_code();
51 int pc_offset = static_cast<int>(frame->pc() - old_code->instruction_start());
52 base::Vector<const uint8_t> old_pos_table = old_code->source_positions();
53 SourcePositionTableIterator old_it(old_pos_table);
54 int call_offset = -1;
55 while (!old_it.done() && old_it.code_offset() < pc_offset) {
56 call_offset = old_it.code_offset();
57 old_it.Advance();
58 }
59 DCHECK_LE(0, call_offset);
60 int call_instruction_size = pc_offset - call_offset;
61
62 // If {return_location == kAfterBreakpoint} we search for the first code
63 // offset which is marked as instruction (i.e. not the breakpoint).
64 // If {return_location == kAfterWasmCall} we return the last code offset
65 // associated with the byte offset.
66 SourcePositionTableIterator it(new_pos_table);
67 while (!it.done() && it.source_position().ScriptOffset() != byte_offset) {
68 it.Advance();
69 }
70 if (return_location == kAfterBreakpoint) {
71 while (!it.is_statement()) it.Advance();
72 DCHECK_EQ(byte_offset, it.source_position().ScriptOffset());
73 return wasm_code->instruction_start() + it.code_offset() +
74 call_instruction_size;
75 }
76
77 DCHECK_EQ(kAfterWasmCall, return_location);
78 int code_offset;
79 do {
80 code_offset = it.code_offset();
81 it.Advance();
82 } while (!it.done() && it.source_position().ScriptOffset() == byte_offset);
83 return wasm_code->instruction_start() + code_offset + call_instruction_size;
84}
85
86} // namespace
87
88void DebugSideTable::Print(std::ostream& os) const {
89 os << "Debug side table (" << num_locals_ << " locals, " << entries_.size()
90 << " entries):\n";
91 for (auto& entry : entries_) entry.Print(os);
92 os << "\n";
93}
94
95void DebugSideTable::Entry::Print(std::ostream& os) const {
96 os << std::setw(6) << std::hex << pc_offset_ << std::dec << " stack height "
97 << stack_height_ << " [";
98 for (auto& value : changed_values_) {
99 os << " " << value.type.name() << ":";
100 switch (value.storage) {
101 case kConstant:
102 os << "const#" << value.i32_const;
103 break;
104 case kRegister:
105 os << "reg#" << value.reg_code;
106 break;
107 case kStack:
108 os << "stack#" << value.stack_offset;
109 break;
110 }
111 }
112 os << " ]\n";
113}
114
115size_t DebugSideTable::Entry::EstimateCurrentMemoryConsumption() const {
116 UPDATE_WHEN_CLASS_CHANGES(DebugSideTable::Entry, 32);
117 return ContentSize(changed_values_);
118}
119
120size_t DebugSideTable::EstimateCurrentMemoryConsumption() const {
121 UPDATE_WHEN_CLASS_CHANGES(DebugSideTable, 32);
122 size_t result = sizeof(DebugSideTable) + ContentSize(entries_);
123 for (const Entry& entry : entries_) {
124 result += entry.EstimateCurrentMemoryConsumption();
125 }
126 return result;
127}
128
129class DebugInfoImpl {
130 public:
131 explicit DebugInfoImpl(NativeModule* native_module)
132 : native_module_(native_module) {}
133
134 DebugInfoImpl(const DebugInfoImpl&) = delete;
135 DebugInfoImpl& operator=(const DebugInfoImpl&) = delete;
136
137 int GetNumLocals(Address pc, Isolate* isolate) {
138 FrameInspectionScope scope(this, pc, isolate);
139 if (!scope.is_inspectable()) return 0;
140 return scope.debug_side_table->num_locals();
141 }
142
143 WasmValue GetLocalValue(int local, Address pc, Address fp,
144 Address debug_break_fp, Isolate* isolate) {
145 FrameInspectionScope scope(this, pc, isolate);
146 return GetValue(scope.debug_side_table, scope.debug_side_table_entry, local,
147 fp, debug_break_fp, isolate);
148 }
149
150 int GetStackDepth(Address pc, Isolate* isolate) {
151 FrameInspectionScope scope(this, pc, isolate);
152 if (!scope.is_inspectable()) return 0;
153 int num_locals = scope.debug_side_table->num_locals();
154 int stack_height = scope.debug_side_table_entry->stack_height();
155 return stack_height - num_locals;
156 }
157
158 WasmValue GetStackValue(int index, Address pc, Address fp,
159 Address debug_break_fp, Isolate* isolate) {
160 FrameInspectionScope scope(this, pc, isolate);
161 int num_locals = scope.debug_side_table->num_locals();
162 int value_count = scope.debug_side_table_entry->stack_height();
163 if (num_locals + index >= value_count) return {};
164 return GetValue(scope.debug_side_table, scope.debug_side_table_entry,
165 num_locals + index, fp, debug_break_fp, isolate);
166 }
167
168 const WasmFunction& GetFunctionAtAddress(Address pc, Isolate* isolate) {
169 FrameInspectionScope scope(this, pc, isolate);
170 auto* module = native_module_->module();
171 return module->functions[scope.code->index()];
172 }
173
174 // If the frame position is not in the list of breakpoints, return that
175 // position. Return 0 otherwise.
176 // This is used to generate a "dead breakpoint" in Liftoff, which is necessary
177 // for OSR to find the correct return address.
178 int DeadBreakpoint(WasmFrame* frame, base::Vector<const int> breakpoints) {
179 const auto& function =
180 native_module_->module()->functions[frame->function_index()];
181 int offset = frame->position() - function.code.offset();
182 if (std::binary_search(breakpoints.begin(), breakpoints.end(), offset)) {
183 return 0;
184 }
185 return offset;
186 }
187
188 // Find the dead breakpoint (see above) for the top wasm frame, if that frame
189 // is in the function of the given index.
190 int DeadBreakpoint(int func_index, base::Vector<const int> breakpoints,
191 Isolate* isolate) {
192 DebuggableStackFrameIterator it(isolate);
193 if (it.done() || !it.is_wasm()) return 0;
194 auto* wasm_frame = WasmFrame::cast(it.frame());
195 if (static_cast<int>(wasm_frame->function_index()) != func_index) return 0;
196 return DeadBreakpoint(wasm_frame, breakpoints);
197 }
198
199 WasmCode* RecompileLiftoffWithBreakpoints(int func_index,
200 base::Vector<const int> offsets,
201 int dead_breakpoint) {
202 DCHECK(!mutex_.TryLock()); // Mutex is held externally.
203
204 ForDebugging for_debugging = offsets.size() == 1 && offsets[0] == 0
205 ? kForStepping
206 : kWithBreakpoints;
207
208 // Check the cache first.
209 for (auto begin = cached_debugging_code_.begin(), it = begin,
210 end = cached_debugging_code_.end();
211 it != end; ++it) {
212 if (it->func_index == func_index &&
213 it->breakpoint_offsets.as_vector() == offsets &&
214 it->dead_breakpoint == dead_breakpoint) {
215 // Rotate the cache entry to the front (for LRU).
216 for (; it != begin; --it) std::iter_swap(it, it - 1);
217 if (for_debugging == kWithBreakpoints) {
218 // Re-install the code, in case it was replaced in the meantime.
219 native_module_->ReinstallDebugCode(it->code);
220 }
221 return it->code;
222 }
223 }
224
225 // Recompile the function with Liftoff, setting the new breakpoints.
226 // Not thread-safe. The caller is responsible for locking {mutex_}.
227 CompilationEnv env = CompilationEnv::ForModule(native_module_);
228 const WasmFunction* function = &env.module->functions[func_index];
229 base::Vector<const uint8_t> wire_bytes = native_module_->wire_bytes();
230 bool is_shared = env.module->types[function->sig_index].is_shared;
231 FunctionBody body{function->sig, function->code.offset(),
232 wire_bytes.begin() + function->code.offset(),
233 wire_bytes.begin() + function->code.end_offset(),
234 is_shared};
235 std::unique_ptr<DebugSideTable> debug_sidetable;
236
237 // Debug side tables for stepping are generated lazily.
238 bool generate_debug_sidetable = for_debugging == kWithBreakpoints;
239 // If lazy validation is on, we might need to lazily validate here.
240 if (V8_UNLIKELY(!env.module->function_was_validated(func_index))) {
241 WasmFeatures unused_detected_features;
242 Zone validation_zone(wasm::GetWasmEngine()->allocator(), ZONE_NAME);
243 DecodeResult validation_result =
244 ValidateFunctionBody(&validation_zone, env.enabled_features,
245 env.module, &unused_detected_features, body);
246 // Handling illegal modules here is tricky. As lazy validation is off by
247 // default anyway and this is for debugging only, we just crash for now.
248 CHECK_WITH_MSG(validation_result.ok(),
249 validation_result.error().message().c_str());
250 env.module->set_function_validated(func_index);
251 }
252 WasmCompilationResult result = ExecuteLiftoffCompilation(
253 &env, body,
254 LiftoffOptions{}
255 .set_func_index(func_index)
256 .set_for_debugging(for_debugging)
257 .set_breakpoints(offsets)
258 .set_dead_breakpoint(dead_breakpoint)
259 .set_debug_sidetable(generate_debug_sidetable ? &debug_sidetable
260 : nullptr));
261 // Liftoff compilation failure is a FATAL error. We rely on complete Liftoff
262 // support for debugging.
263 if (!result.succeeded()) FATAL("Liftoff compilation failed");
264 DCHECK_EQ(generate_debug_sidetable, debug_sidetable != nullptr);
265
266 WasmCode* new_code =
267 native_module_->PublishCode(native_module_->AddCompiledCode(result));
268
269 DCHECK(new_code->is_inspectable());
270 if (generate_debug_sidetable) {
271 base::MutexGuard lock(&debug_side_tables_mutex_);
272 DCHECK_EQ(0, debug_side_tables_.count(new_code));
273 debug_side_tables_.emplace(new_code, std::move(debug_sidetable));
274 }
275
276 // Insert new code into the cache. Insert before existing elements for LRU.
277 cached_debugging_code_.insert(
278 cached_debugging_code_.begin(),
279 CachedDebuggingCode{func_index, base::OwnedVector<int>::Of(offsets),
280 dead_breakpoint, new_code});
281 // Increase the ref count (for the cache entry).
282 new_code->IncRef();
283 // Remove exceeding element.
284 if (cached_debugging_code_.size() > kMaxCachedDebuggingCode) {
285 // Put the code in the surrounding CodeRefScope to delay deletion until
286 // after the mutex is released.
287 WasmCodeRefScope::AddRef(cached_debugging_code_.back().code);
288 cached_debugging_code_.back().code->DecRefOnLiveCode();
289 cached_debugging_code_.pop_back();
290 }
291 DCHECK_GE(kMaxCachedDebuggingCode, cached_debugging_code_.size());
292
293 return new_code;
294 }
295
296 void SetBreakpoint(int func_index, int offset, Isolate* isolate) {
297 // Put the code ref scope outside of the mutex, so we don't unnecessarily
298 // hold the mutex while freeing code.
299 WasmCodeRefScope wasm_code_ref_scope;
300
301 // Hold the mutex while modifying breakpoints, to ensure consistency when
302 // multiple isolates set/remove breakpoints at the same time.
303 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
304
305 // offset == 0 indicates flooding and should not happen here.
306 DCHECK_NE(0, offset);
307
308 // Get the set of previously set breakpoints, to check later whether a new
309 // breakpoint was actually added.
310 std::vector<int> all_breakpoints = FindAllBreakpoints(func_index);
311
312 auto& isolate_data = per_isolate_data_[isolate];
313 std::vector<int>& breakpoints =
314 isolate_data.breakpoints_per_function[func_index];
315 auto insertion_point =
316 std::lower_bound(breakpoints.begin(), breakpoints.end(), offset);
317 if (insertion_point != breakpoints.end() && *insertion_point == offset) {
318 // The breakpoint is already set for this isolate.
319 return;
320 }
321 breakpoints.insert(insertion_point, offset);
322
323 DCHECK(std::is_sorted(all_breakpoints.begin(), all_breakpoints.end()));
324 // Find the insertion position within {all_breakpoints}.
325 insertion_point = std::lower_bound(all_breakpoints.begin(),
326 all_breakpoints.end(), offset);
327 bool breakpoint_exists =
328 insertion_point != all_breakpoints.end() && *insertion_point == offset;
329 // If the breakpoint was already set before, then we can just reuse the old
330 // code. Otherwise, recompile it. In any case, rewrite this isolate's stack
331 // to make sure that it uses up-to-date code containing the breakpoint.
332 WasmCode* new_code;
333 if (breakpoint_exists) {
334 new_code = native_module_->GetCode(func_index);
335 } else {
336 all_breakpoints.insert(insertion_point, offset);
337 int dead_breakpoint =
338 DeadBreakpoint(func_index, base::VectorOf(all_breakpoints), isolate);
339 new_code = RecompileLiftoffWithBreakpoints(
340 func_index, base::VectorOf(all_breakpoints), dead_breakpoint);
341 }
342 UpdateReturnAddresses(isolate, new_code, isolate_data.stepping_frame);
343 }
344
345 std::vector<int> FindAllBreakpoints(int func_index) {
346 DCHECK(!mutex_.TryLock()); // Mutex must be held externally.
347 std::set<int> breakpoints;
348 for (auto& data : per_isolate_data_) {
349 auto it = data.second.breakpoints_per_function.find(func_index);
350 if (it == data.second.breakpoints_per_function.end()) continue;
351 for (int offset : it->second) breakpoints.insert(offset);
352 }
353 return {breakpoints.begin(), breakpoints.end()};
354 }
355
356 void UpdateBreakpoints(int func_index, base::Vector<int> breakpoints,
357 Isolate* isolate, StackFrameId stepping_frame,
358 int dead_breakpoint) {
359 DCHECK(!mutex_.TryLock()); // Mutex is held externally.
360 WasmCode* new_code = RecompileLiftoffWithBreakpoints(
361 func_index, breakpoints, dead_breakpoint);
362 UpdateReturnAddresses(isolate, new_code, stepping_frame);
363 }
364
365 void FloodWithBreakpoints(WasmFrame* frame, ReturnLocation return_location) {
366 // 0 is an invalid offset used to indicate flooding.
367 constexpr int kFloodingBreakpoints[] = {0};
368 DCHECK(frame->wasm_code()->is_liftoff());
369 // Generate an additional source position for the current byte offset.
370 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
371 WasmCode* new_code = RecompileLiftoffWithBreakpoints(
372 frame->function_index(), base::ArrayVector(kFloodingBreakpoints), 0);
373 UpdateReturnAddress(frame, new_code, return_location);
374
375 per_isolate_data_[frame->isolate()].stepping_frame = frame->id();
376 }
377
378 bool PrepareStep(WasmFrame* frame) {
379 WasmCodeRefScope wasm_code_ref_scope;
380 wasm::WasmCode* code = frame->wasm_code();
381 if (!code->is_liftoff()) return false; // Cannot step in TurboFan code.
382 if (IsAtReturn(frame)) return false; // Will return after this step.
383 FloodWithBreakpoints(frame, kAfterBreakpoint);
384 return true;
385 }
386
387 void PrepareStepOutTo(WasmFrame* frame) {
388 WasmCodeRefScope wasm_code_ref_scope;
389 wasm::WasmCode* code = frame->wasm_code();
390 if (!code->is_liftoff()) return; // Cannot step out to TurboFan code.
391 FloodWithBreakpoints(frame, kAfterWasmCall);
392 }
393
394 void ClearStepping(WasmFrame* frame) {
395 WasmCodeRefScope wasm_code_ref_scope;
396 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
397 auto* code = frame->wasm_code();
398 if (code->for_debugging() != kForStepping) return;
399 int func_index = code->index();
400 std::vector<int> breakpoints = FindAllBreakpoints(func_index);
401 int dead_breakpoint = DeadBreakpoint(frame, base::VectorOf(breakpoints));
402 WasmCode* new_code = RecompileLiftoffWithBreakpoints(
403 func_index, base::VectorOf(breakpoints), dead_breakpoint);
404 UpdateReturnAddress(frame, new_code, kAfterBreakpoint);
405 }
406
407 void ClearStepping(Isolate* isolate) {
408 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
409 auto it = per_isolate_data_.find(isolate);
410 if (it != per_isolate_data_.end()) it->second.stepping_frame = NO_ID;
411 }
412
413 bool IsStepping(WasmFrame* frame) {
414 Isolate* isolate = frame->wasm_instance()->GetIsolate();
415 if (isolate->debug()->last_step_action() == StepInto) return true;
416 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
417 auto it = per_isolate_data_.find(isolate);
418 return it != per_isolate_data_.end() &&
419 it->second.stepping_frame == frame->id();
420 }
421
422 void RemoveBreakpoint(int func_index, int position, Isolate* isolate) {
423 // Put the code ref scope outside of the mutex, so we don't unnecessarily
424 // hold the mutex while freeing code.
425 WasmCodeRefScope wasm_code_ref_scope;
426
427 // Hold the mutex while modifying breakpoints, to ensure consistency when
428 // multiple isolates set/remove breakpoints at the same time.
429 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
430
431 const auto& function = native_module_->module()->functions[func_index];
432 int offset = position - function.code.offset();
433
434 auto& isolate_data = per_isolate_data_[isolate];
435 std::vector<int>& breakpoints =
436 isolate_data.breakpoints_per_function[func_index];
437 DCHECK_LT(0, offset);
438 auto insertion_point =
439 std::lower_bound(breakpoints.begin(), breakpoints.end(), offset);
440 if (insertion_point == breakpoints.end()) return;
441 if (*insertion_point != offset) return;
442 breakpoints.erase(insertion_point);
443
444 std::vector<int> remaining = FindAllBreakpoints(func_index);
445 // If the breakpoint is still set in another isolate, don't remove it.
446 DCHECK(std::is_sorted(remaining.begin(), remaining.end()));
447 if (std::binary_search(remaining.begin(), remaining.end(), offset)) return;
448 int dead_breakpoint =
449 DeadBreakpoint(func_index, base::VectorOf(remaining), isolate);
450 UpdateBreakpoints(func_index, base::VectorOf(remaining), isolate,
451 isolate_data.stepping_frame, dead_breakpoint);
452 }
453
454 void RemoveDebugSideTables(base::Vector<WasmCode* const> codes) {
455 base::MutexGuard guard(&debug_side_tables_mutex_);
456 for (auto* code : codes) {
457 debug_side_tables_.erase(code);
458 }
459 }
460
461 DebugSideTable* GetDebugSideTableIfExists(const WasmCode* code) const {
462 base::MutexGuard guard(&debug_side_tables_mutex_);
463 auto it = debug_side_tables_.find(code);
464 return it == debug_side_tables_.end() ? nullptr : it->second.get();
465 }
466
467 static bool HasRemovedBreakpoints(const std::vector<int>& removed,
468 const std::vector<int>& remaining) {
469 DCHECK(std::is_sorted(remaining.begin(), remaining.end()));
470 for (int offset : removed) {
471 // Return true if we removed a breakpoint which is not part of remaining.
472 if (!std::binary_search(remaining.begin(), remaining.end(), offset)) {
473 return true;
474 }
475 }
476 return false;
477 }
478
479 void RemoveIsolate(Isolate* isolate) {
480 // Put the code ref scope outside of the mutex, so we don't unnecessarily
481 // hold the mutex while freeing code.
482 WasmCodeRefScope wasm_code_ref_scope;
483
484 base::MutexGuard guard(&mutex_);
485 auto per_isolate_data_it = per_isolate_data_.find(isolate);
486 if (per_isolate_data_it == per_isolate_data_.end()) return;
487 std::unordered_map<int, std::vector<int>> removed_per_function =
488 std::move(per_isolate_data_it->second.breakpoints_per_function);
489 per_isolate_data_.erase(per_isolate_data_it);
490 for (auto& entry : removed_per_function) {
491 int func_index = entry.first;
492 std::vector<int>& removed = entry.second;
493 std::vector<int> remaining = FindAllBreakpoints(func_index);
494 if (HasRemovedBreakpoints(removed, remaining)) {
495 RecompileLiftoffWithBreakpoints(func_index, base::VectorOf(remaining),
496 0);
497 }
498 }
499 }
500
501 size_t EstimateCurrentMemoryConsumption() const {
502 UPDATE_WHEN_CLASS_CHANGES(DebugInfoImpl, 208);
503 UPDATE_WHEN_CLASS_CHANGES(CachedDebuggingCode, 40);
504 UPDATE_WHEN_CLASS_CHANGES(PerIsolateDebugData, 48);
505 size_t result = sizeof(DebugInfoImpl);
506 {
507 base::MutexGuard lock(&debug_side_tables_mutex_);
508 result += ContentSize(debug_side_tables_);
509 for (const auto& [code, table] : debug_side_tables_) {
510 result += table->EstimateCurrentMemoryConsumption();
511 }
512 }
513 {
514 base::MutexGuard lock(&mutex_);
515 result += ContentSize(cached_debugging_code_);
516 for (const CachedDebuggingCode& code : cached_debugging_code_) {
517 result += code.breakpoint_offsets.size() * sizeof(int);
518 }
519 result += ContentSize(per_isolate_data_);
520 for (const auto& [isolate, data] : per_isolate_data_) {
521 // Inlined handling of {PerIsolateDebugData}.
522 result += ContentSize(data.breakpoints_per_function);
523 for (const auto& [idx, breakpoints] : data.breakpoints_per_function) {
524 result += ContentSize(breakpoints);
525 }
526 }
527 }
528 if (v8_flags.trace_wasm_offheap_memory) {
529 PrintF("DebugInfo: %zu\n", result);
530 }
531 return result;
532 }
533
534 private:
535 struct FrameInspectionScope {
536 FrameInspectionScope(DebugInfoImpl* debug_info, Address pc,
537 Isolate* isolate)
538 : code(wasm::GetWasmCodeManager()->LookupCode(isolate, pc)),
539 pc_offset(static_cast<int>(pc - code->instruction_start())),
540 debug_side_table(code->is_inspectable()
541 ? debug_info->GetDebugSideTable(code)
542 : nullptr),
543 debug_side_table_entry(debug_side_table
544 ? debug_side_table->GetEntry(pc_offset)
545 : nullptr) {
546 DCHECK_IMPLIES(code->is_inspectable(), debug_side_table_entry != nullptr);
547 }
548
549 bool is_inspectable() const { return debug_side_table_entry; }
550
551 wasm::WasmCodeRefScope wasm_code_ref_scope;
552 wasm::WasmCode* code;
553 int pc_offset;
554 const DebugSideTable* debug_side_table;
555 const DebugSideTable::Entry* debug_side_table_entry;
556 };
557
558 const DebugSideTable* GetDebugSideTable(WasmCode* code) {
559 DCHECK(code->is_inspectable());
560 {
561 // Only hold the mutex temporarily. We can't hold it while generating the
562 // debug side table, because compilation takes the {NativeModule} lock.
563 base::MutexGuard guard(&debug_side_tables_mutex_);
564 auto it = debug_side_tables_.find(code);
565 if (it != debug_side_tables_.end()) return it->second.get();
566 }
567
568 // Otherwise create the debug side table now.
569 std::unique_ptr<DebugSideTable> debug_side_table =
570 GenerateLiftoffDebugSideTable(code);
571 DebugSideTable* ret = debug_side_table.get();
572
573 // Check cache again, maybe another thread concurrently generated a debug
574 // side table already.
575 {
576 base::MutexGuard guard(&debug_side_tables_mutex_);
577 auto& slot = debug_side_tables_[code];
578 if (slot != nullptr) return slot.get();
579 slot = std::move(debug_side_table);
580 }
581
582 // Print the code together with the debug table, if requested.
583 code->MaybePrint();
584 return ret;
585 }
586
587 // Get the value of a local (including parameters) or stack value. Stack
588 // values follow the locals in the same index space.
589 WasmValue GetValue(const DebugSideTable* debug_side_table,
590 const DebugSideTable::Entry* debug_side_table_entry,
591 int index, Address stack_frame_base,
592 Address debug_break_fp, Isolate* isolate) const {
593 const auto* value =
594 debug_side_table->FindValue(debug_side_table_entry, index);
595 if (value->is_constant()) {
596 DCHECK(value->type == kWasmI32 || value->type == kWasmI64);
597 return value->type == kWasmI32 ? WasmValue(value->i32_const)
598 : WasmValue(int64_t{value->i32_const});
599 }
600
601 if (value->is_register()) {
602 auto reg = LiftoffRegister::from_liftoff_code(value->reg_code);
603 auto gp_addr = [debug_break_fp](Register reg) {
604 return debug_break_fp +
605 WasmDebugBreakFrameConstants::GetPushedGpRegisterOffset(
606 reg.code());
607 };
608 if (reg.is_gp_pair()) {
609 DCHECK_EQ(kWasmI64, value->type);
610 uint32_t low_word = ReadUnalignedValue<uint32_t>(gp_addr(reg.low_gp()));
611 uint32_t high_word =
612 ReadUnalignedValue<uint32_t>(gp_addr(reg.high_gp()));
613 return WasmValue((uint64_t{high_word} << 32) | low_word);
614 }
615 if (reg.is_gp()) {
616 if (value->type == kWasmI32) {
617 return WasmValue(ReadUnalignedValue<uint32_t>(gp_addr(reg.gp())));
618 } else if (value->type == kWasmI64) {
619 return WasmValue(ReadUnalignedValue<uint64_t>(gp_addr(reg.gp())));
620 } else if (value->type.is_reference()) {
621 Handle<Object> obj(
622 Tagged<Object>(ReadUnalignedValue<Address>(gp_addr(reg.gp()))),
623 isolate);
624 return WasmValue(obj, value->type);
625 } else {
626 UNREACHABLE();
627 }
628 }
629 DCHECK(reg.is_fp() || reg.is_fp_pair());
630 // ifdef here to workaround unreachable code for is_fp_pair.
631#ifdef V8_TARGET_ARCH_ARM
632 int code = reg.is_fp_pair() ? reg.low_fp().code() : reg.fp().code();
633#else
634 int code = reg.fp().code();
635#endif
636 Address spilled_addr =
637 debug_break_fp +
638 WasmDebugBreakFrameConstants::GetPushedFpRegisterOffset(code);
639 if (value->type == kWasmF32) {
640 return WasmValue(ReadUnalignedValue<float>(spilled_addr));
641 } else if (value->type == kWasmF64) {
642 return WasmValue(ReadUnalignedValue<double>(spilled_addr));
643 } else if (value->type == kWasmS128) {
644 return WasmValue(Simd128(ReadUnalignedValue<int16>(spilled_addr)));
645 } else {
646 // All other cases should have been handled above.
647 UNREACHABLE();
648 }
649 }
650
651 // Otherwise load the value from the stack.
652 Address stack_address = stack_frame_base - value->stack_offset;
653 switch (value->type.kind()) {
654 case kI32:
655 return WasmValue(ReadUnalignedValue<int32_t>(stack_address));
656 case kI64:
657 return WasmValue(ReadUnalignedValue<int64_t>(stack_address));
658 case kF32:
659 return WasmValue(ReadUnalignedValue<float>(stack_address));
660 case kF64:
661 return WasmValue(ReadUnalignedValue<double>(stack_address));
662 case kS128:
663 return WasmValue(Simd128(ReadUnalignedValue<int16>(stack_address)));
664 case kRef:
665 case kRefNull:
666 case kRtt: {
667 Handle<Object> obj(
668 Tagged<Object>(ReadUnalignedValue<Address>(stack_address)),
669 isolate);
670 return WasmValue(obj, value->type);
671 }
672 case kI8:
673 case kI16:
674 case kVoid:
675 case kBottom:
676 UNREACHABLE();
677 }
678 }
679
680 // After installing a Liftoff code object with a different set of breakpoints,
681 // update return addresses on the stack so that execution resumes in the new
682 // code. The frame layout itself should be independent of breakpoints.
683 void UpdateReturnAddresses(Isolate* isolate, WasmCode* new_code,
684 StackFrameId stepping_frame) {
685 // The first return location is after the breakpoint, others are after wasm
686 // calls.
687 ReturnLocation return_location = kAfterBreakpoint;
688 for (DebuggableStackFrameIterator it(isolate); !it.done();
689 it.Advance(), return_location = kAfterWasmCall) {
690 // We still need the flooded function for stepping.
691 if (it.frame()->id() == stepping_frame) continue;
692 if (!it.is_wasm()) continue;
693 WasmFrame* frame = WasmFrame::cast(it.frame());
694 if (frame->native_module() != new_code->native_module()) continue;
695 if (frame->function_index() != new_code->index()) continue;
696 if (!frame->wasm_code()->is_liftoff()) continue;
697 UpdateReturnAddress(frame, new_code, return_location);
698 }
699 }
700
701 void UpdateReturnAddress(WasmFrame* frame, WasmCode* new_code,
702 ReturnLocation return_location) {
703 DCHECK(new_code->is_liftoff());
704 DCHECK_EQ(frame->function_index(), new_code->index());
705 DCHECK_EQ(frame->native_module(), new_code->native_module());
706 DCHECK(frame->wasm_code()->is_liftoff());
707 Address new_pc = FindNewPC(frame, new_code, frame->generated_code_offset(),
708 return_location);
709#ifdef DEBUG
710 int old_position = frame->position();
711#endif
712#if V8_TARGET_ARCH_X64
713 if (frame->wasm_code()->for_debugging()) {
714 base::Memory<Address>(frame->fp() - kOSRTargetOffset) = new_pc;
715 }
716#else
717 PointerAuthentication::ReplacePC(frame->pc_address(), new_pc,
718 kSystemPointerSize);
719#endif
720 // The frame position should still be the same after OSR.
721 DCHECK_EQ(old_position, frame->position());
722 }
723
724 bool IsAtReturn(WasmFrame* frame) {
725 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
726 int position = frame->position();
727 NativeModule* native_module = frame->native_module();
728 uint8_t opcode = native_module->wire_bytes()[position];
729 if (opcode == kExprReturn) return true;
730 // Another implicit return is at the last kExprEnd in the function body.
731 int func_index = frame->function_index();
732 WireBytesRef code = native_module->module()->functions[func_index].code;
733 return static_cast<size_t>(position) == code.end_offset() - 1;
734 }
735
736 // Isolate-specific data, for debugging modules that are shared by multiple
737 // isolates.
738 struct PerIsolateDebugData {
739 // Keeps track of the currently set breakpoints (by offset within that
740 // function).
741 std::unordered_map<int, std::vector<int>> breakpoints_per_function;
742
743 // Store the frame ID when stepping, to avoid overwriting that frame when
744 // setting or removing a breakpoint.
745 StackFrameId stepping_frame = NO_ID;
746 };
747
748 NativeModule* const native_module_;
749
750 mutable base::Mutex debug_side_tables_mutex_;
751
752 // DebugSideTable per code object, lazily initialized.
753 std::unordered_map<const WasmCode*, std::unique_ptr<DebugSideTable>>
754 debug_side_tables_;
755
756 // {mutex_} protects all fields below.
757 mutable base::Mutex mutex_;
758
759 // Cache a fixed number of WasmCode objects that were generated for debugging.
760 // This is useful especially in stepping, because stepping code is cleared on
761 // every pause and re-installed on the next step.
762 // This is a LRU cache (most recently used entries first).
763 static constexpr size_t kMaxCachedDebuggingCode = 3;
764 struct CachedDebuggingCode {
765 int func_index;
766 base::OwnedVector<const int> breakpoint_offsets;
767 int dead_breakpoint;
768 WasmCode* code;
769 };
770 std::vector<CachedDebuggingCode> cached_debugging_code_;
771
772 // Isolate-specific data.
773 std::unordered_map<Isolate*, PerIsolateDebugData> per_isolate_data_;
774};
775

777 : impl_(std::make_unique<DebugInfoImpl>(native_module)) {}

849} // namespace wasm
850
851namespace {
852
853// Return the next breakable position at or after {offset_in_func} in function
854// {func_index}, or 0 if there is none.
855// Note that 0 is never a breakable position in wasm, since the first uint8_t
856// contains the locals count for the function.
857int FindNextBreakablePosition(wasm::NativeModule* native_module, int func_index,
858 int offset_in_func) {
859 Zone zone{wasm::GetWasmEngine()->allocator(), ZONE_NAME};
860 wasm::BodyLocalDecls locals;
861 const uint8_t* module_start = native_module->wire_bytes().begin();
862 const wasm::WasmFunction& func =
863 native_module->module()->functions[func_index];
864 wasm::BytecodeIterator iterator(module_start + func.code.offset(),
865 module_start + func.code.end_offset(),
866 &locals, &zone);
867 DCHECK_LT(0, locals.encoded_size);
868 if (offset_in_func < 0) return 0;
869 for (; iterator.has_next(); iterator.next()) {
870 if (iterator.pc_offset() < static_cast<uint32_t>(offset_in_func)) continue;
871 if (!wasm::WasmOpcodes::IsBreakable(iterator.current())) continue;
872 return static_cast<int>(iterator.pc_offset());
873 }
874 return 0;
875}
876
877void SetBreakOnEntryFlag(Tagged<Script> script, bool enabled) {
878 if (script->break_on_entry() == enabled) return;
879
880 script->set_break_on_entry(enabled);
881 // Update the "break_on_entry" flag on all live instances.
882 i::Tagged<i::WeakArrayList> weak_instance_list =
883 script->wasm_weak_instance_list();
884 i::Isolate* isolate = script->GetIsolate();
885 for (int i = 0; i < weak_instance_list->length(); ++i) {
886 if (weak_instance_list->Get(i).IsCleared()) continue;
887 i::Tagged<i::WasmInstanceObject> instance =
888 i::WasmInstanceObject::cast(weak_instance_list->Get(i).GetHeapObject());
889 instance->trusted_data(isolate)->set_break_on_entry(enabled);
890 }
891}
892} // namespace
893
894// static
895bool WasmScript::SetBreakPoint(Handle<Script> script, int* position,
896 Handle<BreakPoint> break_point) {
897 DCHECK_NE(kOnEntryBreakpointPosition, *position);
898
899 // Find the function for this breakpoint.
900 const wasm::WasmModule* module = script->wasm_native_module()->module();
901 int func_index = GetContainingWasmFunction(module, *position);
902 if (func_index < 0) return false;
903 const wasm::WasmFunction& func = module->functions[func_index];
904 int offset_in_func = *position - func.code.offset();
905
906 int breakable_offset = FindNextBreakablePosition(script->wasm_native_module(),
907 func_index, offset_in_func);
908 if (breakable_offset == 0) return false;
909 *position = func.code.offset() + breakable_offset;
910
911 return WasmScript::SetBreakPointForFunction(script, func_index,
912 breakable_offset, break_point);
913}
914
915// static
916void WasmScript::SetInstrumentationBreakpoint(Handle<Script> script,
917 Handle<BreakPoint> break_point) {
918 // Special handling for on-entry breakpoints.
919 AddBreakpointToInfo(script, kOnEntryBreakpointPosition, break_point);
920
921 // Update the "break_on_entry" flag on all live instances.
922 SetBreakOnEntryFlag(*script, true);
923}
924
925// static
926bool WasmScript::SetBreakPointOnFirstBreakableForFunction(
927 Handle<Script> script, int func_index, Handle<BreakPoint> break_point) {
928 if (func_index < 0) return false;
929 int offset_in_func = 0;
930
931 int breakable_offset = FindNextBreakablePosition(script->wasm_native_module(),
932 func_index, offset_in_func);
933 if (breakable_offset == 0) return false;
934 return WasmScript::SetBreakPointForFunction(script, func_index,
935 breakable_offset, break_point);
936}
937
938// static
939bool WasmScript::SetBreakPointForFunction(Handle<Script> script, int func_index,
940 int offset,
941 Handle<BreakPoint> break_point) {
942 Isolate* isolate = script->GetIsolate();
943
944 DCHECK_LE(0, func_index);
945 DCHECK_NE(0, offset);
946
947 // Find the function for this breakpoint.
948 wasm::NativeModule* native_module = script->wasm_native_module();
949 const wasm::WasmModule* module = native_module->module();
950 const wasm::WasmFunction& func = module->functions[func_index];
951
952 // Insert new break point into {wasm_breakpoint_infos} of the script.
953 AddBreakpointToInfo(script, func.code.offset() + offset, break_point);
954
955 native_module->GetDebugInfo()->SetBreakpoint(func_index, offset, isolate);
956
957 return true;
958}
959
960namespace {
961
962int GetBreakpointPos(Isolate* isolate,
963 Tagged<Object> break_point_info_or_undef) {
964 if (IsUndefined(break_point_info_or_undef, isolate)) return kMaxInt;
965 return BreakPointInfo::cast(break_point_info_or_undef)->source_position();
966}
967
968int FindBreakpointInfoInsertPos(Isolate* isolate,
969 Handle<FixedArray> breakpoint_infos,
970 int position) {
971 // Find insert location via binary search, taking care of undefined values on
972 // the right. {position} is either {kOnEntryBreakpointPosition} (which is -1),
973 // or positive.
974 DCHECK(position == WasmScript::kOnEntryBreakpointPosition || position > 0);
975
976 int left = 0; // inclusive
977 int right = breakpoint_infos->length(); // exclusive
978 while (right - left > 1) {
979 int mid = left + (right - left) / 2;
980 Tagged<Object> mid_obj = breakpoint_infos->get(mid);
981 if (GetBreakpointPos(isolate, mid_obj) <= position) {
982 left = mid;
983 } else {
984 right = mid;
985 }
986 }
987
988 int left_pos = GetBreakpointPos(isolate, breakpoint_infos->get(left));
989 return left_pos < position ? left + 1 : left;
990}
991
992} // namespace
993
994// static
995bool WasmScript::ClearBreakPoint(Handle<Script> script, int position,
996 Handle<BreakPoint> break_point) {
997 if (!script->has_wasm_breakpoint_infos()) return false;
998
999 Isolate* isolate = script->GetIsolate();
1000 Handle<FixedArray> breakpoint_infos(script->wasm_breakpoint_infos(), isolate);
1001
1002 int pos = FindBreakpointInfoInsertPos(isolate, breakpoint_infos, position);
1003
1004 // Does a BreakPointInfo object already exist for this position?
1005 if (pos == breakpoint_infos->length()) return false;
1006
1007 Handle<BreakPointInfo> info(BreakPointInfo::cast(breakpoint_infos->get(pos)),
1008 isolate);
1009 BreakPointInfo::ClearBreakPoint(isolate, info, break_point);
1010
1011 // Check if there are no more breakpoints at this location.
1012 if (info->GetBreakPointCount(isolate) == 0) {
1013 // Update array by moving breakpoints up one position.
1014 for (int i = pos; i < breakpoint_infos->length() - 1; i++) {
1015 Tagged<Object> entry = breakpoint_infos->get(i + 1);
1016 breakpoint_infos->set(i, entry);
1017 if (IsUndefined(entry, isolate)) break;
1018 }
1019 // Make sure last array element is empty as a result.
1020 breakpoint_infos->set(breakpoint_infos->length() - 1,
1021 ReadOnlyRoots{isolate}.undefined_value(),
1022 SKIP_WRITE_BARRIER);
1023 }
1024
1025 if (break_point->id() == v8::internal::Debug::kInstrumentationId) {
1026 // Special handling for instrumentation breakpoints.
1027 SetBreakOnEntryFlag(*script, false);
1028 } else {
1029 // Remove the breakpoint from DebugInfo and recompile.
1030 wasm::NativeModule* native_module = script->wasm_native_module();
1031 const wasm::WasmModule* module = native_module->module();
1032 int func_index = GetContainingWasmFunction(module, position);
1033 native_module->GetDebugInfo()->RemoveBreakpoint(func_index, position,
1034 isolate);
1035 }
1036
1037 return true;
1038}
1039
1040// static
1041bool WasmScript::ClearBreakPointById(Handle<Script> script, int breakpoint_id) {
1042 if (!script->has_wasm_breakpoint_infos()) {
1043 return false;
1044 }
1045 Isolate* isolate = script->GetIsolate();
1046 Handle<FixedArray> breakpoint_infos(script->wasm_breakpoint_infos(), isolate);
1047 // If the array exists, it should not be empty.
1048 DCHECK_LT(0, breakpoint_infos->length());
1049
1050 for (int i = 0, e = breakpoint_infos->length(); i < e; ++i) {
1051 Handle<Object> obj(breakpoint_infos->get(i), isolate);
1052 if (IsUndefined(*obj, isolate)) {
1053 continue;
1054 }
1055 Handle<BreakPointInfo> breakpoint_info = Handle<BreakPointInfo>::cast(obj);
1056 Handle<BreakPoint> breakpoint;
1057 if (BreakPointInfo::GetBreakPointById(isolate, breakpoint_info,
1058 breakpoint_id)
1059 .ToHandle(&breakpoint)) {
1060 DCHECK(breakpoint->id() == breakpoint_id);
1061 return WasmScript::ClearBreakPoint(
1062 script, breakpoint_info->source_position(), breakpoint);
1063 }
1064 }
1065 return false;
1066}
1067
1068// static
1069void WasmScript::ClearAllBreakpoints(Tagged<Script> script) {
1070 script->set_wasm_breakpoint_infos(
1071 ReadOnlyRoots(script->GetIsolate()).empty_fixed_array());
1072 SetBreakOnEntryFlag(script, false);
1073}
1074
1075// static
1076void WasmScript::AddBreakpointToInfo(Handle<Script> script, int position,
1077 Handle<BreakPoint> break_point) {
1078 Isolate* isolate = script->GetIsolate();
1079 Handle<FixedArray> breakpoint_infos;
1080 if (script->has_wasm_breakpoint_infos()) {
1081 breakpoint_infos = handle(script->wasm_breakpoint_infos(), isolate);
1082 } else {
1083 breakpoint_infos =
1084 isolate->factory()->NewFixedArray(4, AllocationType::kOld);
1085 script->set_wasm_breakpoint_infos(*breakpoint_infos);
1086 }
1087
1088 int insert_pos =
1089 FindBreakpointInfoInsertPos(isolate, breakpoint_infos, position);
1090
1091 // If a BreakPointInfo object already exists for this position, add the new
1092 // breakpoint object and return.
1093 if (insert_pos < breakpoint_infos->length() &&
1094 GetBreakpointPos(isolate, breakpoint_infos->get(insert_pos)) ==
1095 position) {
1096 Handle<BreakPointInfo> old_info(
1097 BreakPointInfo::cast(breakpoint_infos->get(insert_pos)), isolate);
1098 BreakPointInfo::SetBreakPoint(isolate, old_info, break_point);
1099 return;
1100 }
1101
1102 // Enlarge break positions array if necessary.
1103 bool need_realloc = !IsUndefined(
1104 breakpoint_infos->get(breakpoint_infos->length() - 1), isolate);
1105 Handle<FixedArray> new_breakpoint_infos = breakpoint_infos;
1106 if (need_realloc) {
1107 new_breakpoint_infos = isolate->factory()->NewFixedArray(
1108 2 * breakpoint_infos->length(), AllocationType::kOld);
1109 script->set_wasm_breakpoint_infos(*new_breakpoint_infos);
1110 // Copy over the entries [0, insert_pos).
1111 for (int i = 0; i < insert_pos; ++i)
1112 new_breakpoint_infos->set(i, breakpoint_infos->get(i));
1113 }
1114
1115 // Move elements [insert_pos, ...] up by one.
1116 for (int i = breakpoint_infos->length() - 1; i >= insert_pos; --i) {
1117 Tagged<Object> entry = breakpoint_infos->get(i);
1118 if (IsUndefined(entry, isolate)) continue;
1119 new_breakpoint_infos->set(i + 1, entry);
1120 }
1121
1122 // Generate new BreakpointInfo.
1123 Handle<BreakPointInfo> breakpoint_info =
1124 isolate->factory()->NewBreakPointInfo(position);
1125 BreakPointInfo::SetBreakPoint(isolate, breakpoint_info, break_point);
1126
1127 // Now insert new position at insert_pos.
1128 new_breakpoint_infos->set(insert_pos, *breakpoint_info);
1129}
1130
1131// static
1132bool WasmScript::GetPossibleBreakpoints(
1133 wasm::NativeModule* native_module, const v8::debug::Location& start,
1134 const v8::debug::Location& end,
1135 std::vector<v8::debug::BreakLocation>* locations) {
1136 DisallowGarbageCollection no_gc;
1137
1138 const wasm::WasmModule* module = native_module->module();
1139 const std::vector<wasm::WasmFunction>& functions = module->functions;
1140
1141 if (start.GetLineNumber() != 0 || start.GetColumnNumber() < 0 ||
1142 (!end.IsEmpty() &&
1143 (end.GetLineNumber() != 0 || end.GetColumnNumber() < 0 ||
1144 end.GetColumnNumber() < start.GetColumnNumber())))
1145 return false;
1146
1147 // start_func_index, start_offset and end_func_index is inclusive.
1148 // end_offset is exclusive.
1149 // start_offset and end_offset are module-relative byte offsets.
1150 // We set strict to false because offsets may be between functions.
1151 int start_func_index =
1152 GetNearestWasmFunction(module, start.GetColumnNumber());
1153 if (start_func_index < 0) return false;
1154 uint32_t start_offset = start.GetColumnNumber();
1155 int end_func_index;
1156 uint32_t end_offset;
1157
1158 if (end.IsEmpty()) {
1159 // Default: everything till the end of the Script.
1160 end_func_index = static_cast<uint32_t>(functions.size() - 1);
1161 end_offset = functions[end_func_index].code.end_offset();
1162 } else {
1163 // If end is specified: Use it and check for valid input.
1164 end_offset = end.GetColumnNumber();
1165 end_func_index = GetNearestWasmFunction(module, end_offset);
1166 DCHECK_GE(end_func_index, start_func_index);
1167 }
1168
1169 if (start_func_index == end_func_index &&
1170 start_offset > functions[end_func_index].code.end_offset())
1171 return false;
1172 Zone zone{wasm::GetWasmEngine()->allocator(), ZONE_NAME};
1173 const uint8_t* module_start = native_module->wire_bytes().begin();
1174
1175 for (int func_idx = start_func_index; func_idx <= end_func_index;
1176 ++func_idx) {
1177 const wasm::WasmFunction& func = functions[func_idx];
1178 if (func.code.length() == 0) continue;
1179
1180 wasm::BodyLocalDecls locals;
1181 wasm::BytecodeIterator iterator(module_start + func.code.offset(),
1182 module_start + func.code.end_offset(),
1183 &locals, &zone);
1184 DCHECK_LT(0u, locals.encoded_size);
1185 for (; iterator.has_next(); iterator.next()) {
1186 uint32_t total_offset = func.code.offset() + iterator.pc_offset();
1187 if (total_offset >= end_offset) {
1188 DCHECK_EQ(end_func_index, func_idx);
1189 break;
1190 }
1191 if (total_offset < start_offset) continue;
1192 if (!wasm::WasmOpcodes::IsBreakable(iterator.current())) continue;
1193 locations->emplace_back(0, total_offset, debug::kCommonBreakLocation);
1194 }
1195 }
1196 return true;
1197}
1198
1199namespace {
1200
1201bool CheckBreakPoint(Isolate* isolate, Handle<BreakPoint> break_point,
1202 StackFrameId frame_id) {
1203 if (break_point->condition()->length() == 0) return true;
1204
1205 HandleScope scope(isolate);
1206 Handle<String> condition(break_point->condition(), isolate);
1207 Handle<Object> result;
1208 // The Wasm engine doesn't perform any sort of inlining.
1209 const int inlined_jsframe_index = 0;
1210 const bool throw_on_side_effect = false;
1211 if (!DebugEvaluate::Local(isolate, frame_id, inlined_jsframe_index, condition,
1212 throw_on_side_effect)
1213 .ToHandle(&result)) {
1214 isolate->clear_exception();
1215 return false;
1216 }
1217 return Object::BooleanValue(*result, isolate);
1218}
1219
1220} // namespace
1221
1222// static
1223MaybeHandle<FixedArray> WasmScript::CheckBreakPoints(Isolate* isolate,
1224 Handle<Script> script,
1225 int position,
1226 StackFrameId frame_id) {
1227 if (!script->has_wasm_breakpoint_infos()) return {};
1228
1229 Handle<FixedArray> breakpoint_infos(script->wasm_breakpoint_infos(), isolate);
1230 int insert_pos =
1231 FindBreakpointInfoInsertPos(isolate, breakpoint_infos, position);
1232 if (insert_pos >= breakpoint_infos->length()) return {};
1233
1234 Handle<Object> maybe_breakpoint_info(breakpoint_infos->get(insert_pos),
1235 isolate);
1236 if (IsUndefined(*maybe_breakpoint_info, isolate)) return {};
1237 Handle<BreakPointInfo> breakpoint_info =
1238 Handle<BreakPointInfo>::cast(maybe_breakpoint_info);
1239 if (breakpoint_info->source_position() != position) return {};
1240
1241 Handle<Object> break_points(breakpoint_info->break_points(), isolate);
1242 if (!IsFixedArray(*break_points)) {
1243 if (!CheckBreakPoint(isolate, Handle<BreakPoint>::cast(break_points),
1244 frame_id)) {
1245 return {};
1246 }
1247 Handle<FixedArray> break_points_hit = isolate->factory()->NewFixedArray(1);
1248 break_points_hit->set(0, *break_points);
1249 return break_points_hit;
1250 }
1251
1252 Handle<FixedArray> array = Handle<FixedArray>::cast(break_points);
1253 Handle<FixedArray> break_points_hit =
1254 isolate->factory()->NewFixedArray(array->length());
1255 int break_points_hit_count = 0;
1256 for (int i = 0; i < array->length(); ++i) {
1257 Handle<BreakPoint> break_point(BreakPoint::cast(array->get(i)), isolate);
1258 if (CheckBreakPoint(isolate, break_point, frame_id)) {
1259 break_points_hit->set(break_points_hit_count++, *break_point);
1260 }
1261 }
1262 if (break_points_hit_count == 0) return {};
1263 break_points_hit->RightTrim(isolate, break_points_hit_count);
1264 return break_points_hit;
1265}
1266
1267} // namespace internal
1268} // namespace v8
